alert.note: Alert for Beckham; Blaine; Caddo; Custer; Dewey; Roger Mills; Washita (Oklahoma) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Severe Weather Statement issued July 09 at 2:01AM CDT until July 09 at 6:00AM CDT by NWS Norman-Oklahoma City
info.description: ...A SEVERE THUNDERSTORM WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 215 AM CDT FOR NORTHERN WASHITA...NORTHWESTERN CADDO...EASTERN ROGER MILLS... CUSTER...BLAINE...SOUTHERN DEWEY...NORTHWESTERN CANADIAN AND NORTHEASTERN BECKHAM COUNTIES... At 201 AM CDT, severe thunderstorms were located along a line extending from near Cedar Valley to 3 miles north of Moorewood, moving east at 35 mph. HAZARD...70 mph wind gusts and ping pong ball size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...People and animals outdoors will be injured. Expect hail damage to roofs, siding, windows, and vehicles. Expect considerable tree damage. Wind damage is also likely to mobile homes, roofs, and outbuildings. Locations impacted include... Elk City, Weatherford, Clinton, Watonga, Hinton, Geary, Thomas, Hydro, Arapaho, Hammon, Canute, Leedey, Custer City, Butler, Camargo, Foss, Hitchcock, Bridgeport, Greenfield, and Oakwood. THUNDERSTORM DAMAGE THREAT...CONSIDERABLE HAIL THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...1.50 IN WIND THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX WIND GUST...70 MPH
info.instruction: For your protection move to an interior room on the lowest floor of a building.

area.areaDesc: Beckham; Blaine; Caddo; Custer; Dewey; Roger Mills; Washita
